events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their vehicle and submitted the initial claim with preliminary accident details.
After review, the claim was categorised under Auto Accident due to the nature of the car collision described in the report.
An agent was assigned promptly to handle the case and reach out to the customer within the same day for smoother processing.
The insurance team acknowledged receipt of the claim and informed the policyholder about the next steps.
The agent requested specific documents including the police report, vehicle photos, and medical bills related to the accident.
The customer uploaded all requested documents, including detailed photos of the vehicle damage and the official police report.
The investigation team began analyzing the documents and statements to verify the circumstances of the auto accident claim.
The investigation concluded with confirmation of liability and no discrepancies found in the submitted evidence.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover the vehicle repairs and medical expenses resulting from the collision.
The policyholder expressed satisfaction with the communication and the proposed settlement amount.
The claim was officially approved following the customer's agreement to the settlement terms.
The payment for the approved claim was issued promptly to cover repair costs and other related expenses.
The case was closed after successful payment issuance and confirmation from the customer that the repairs were completed.
The claim file was archived in the system for future reference and compliance purposes.
